agency_desc: A nonprofit health network offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services.
service_description: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_details: Walk in for emergency services; call or visit website for additional information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A commercial organization that offers services for treating substance use disorder.
site_name: ADDICTION RECOVERY CENTERS OF INDIANA - LAGRANGE
service_description: Provides assessment and outpatient substance abuse treatment for adults. Offers comprehensive intake assessment ensures the appropriate level of treatment is provided and is the first step to receiving treatment. Services include educational groups, outpatient counseling, intensive outpatient treatment, and relapse prevention.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an assessment.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Seeking information or treatment for substance use disorder

agency_desc: A faith-based nonprofit organization offering worship services and community outreach programs to those in need.
service_description: Provides a nonperishable food box and frozen food items to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in with required documents. -- Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Living in Lagrange County -- Not received food from a Salvation Army of Greater Elkhart mobile food pantry in the last 30 days

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost tuberculosis (TB) testing to persons required to take the test for work, school, or other programs as well as for those with known exposure or high risk factors.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Restaurant Complaints
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Thurs 7am-5:30pm -- ServeSafe Classes: Call for location and schedule.

site_schedule.name: Food Facility Licensing
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Thurs 7am-5:30pm -- ServeSafe Classes: Call for location and schedule.

site_schedule.name: Restaurant/Food Sanitation
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Thurs 7am-5:30pm -- ServeSafe Classes: Call for location and schedule.

site_schedule.name: Food Safety Education
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Thurs 7am-5:30pm -- ServeSafe Classes: Call for location and schedule.

site_eligibility: Living in LaGrange county
Varies by service
With a private well

Living in withiin the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status
Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate
Living in Lagrange County -- Age 6 months and older
Age 19 or older -- Living in Lagrange County
Varies by service; serves Lagrange County
Varies by service; call for details.

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in LaGrange County. Hears cases involving county ordinance and traffic violations. For information about court appearances, contact the Traffic Court directly.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves. For juror information, call the Voter Registration Office.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
site_name: INDIANA STATE COURTS - SMALL CLAIMS COURT
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $10,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. Landlord/tenant disputes must be filed in the township where the property is located. All other cases may be filed in any township in Lagrange County.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website for claim forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $10,000 -- Meeting one (1) of the following three (3) requirements: Person being sued lives or works in LaGrange County -- - Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Lagrange County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in LaGrange County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the LaGrange County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for information.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the LaGrange County Courts

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Offers delivery of requested library materials to homebound residents of the city of Lagrange in Lagrange County.
site_details: Call to request delivery or visit the website.
site_eligibility: Persons who are home-bound
Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Lagrange County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
site_name: LAGRANGE COUNTY PUBLIC LIBRARY - SHIPSHEWANA BRANCH
service_description: Maintains a public lending library for residents of Lagrange County. Circulates books, eBooks, periodicals, audio books, CDs, and DVDs. Provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Lagrange County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
site_name: LAGRANGE COUNTY PUBLIC LIBRARY - TOPEKA BRANCH
service_description: Offers to meet the informational and educational needs of the residents of LaGrange County in a professional and courteous manner.The LaGrange County Library has a Bookmobile that travels countywide. Patrons can find out the hours and locations of the Bookmobile by contacting the main library or by going to the library's website.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a resident library card: Living in Lagrange County

agency_name: CLOTHES AND FOOD BASKET OF LAGRANGE COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit, community-based food and clothing pantry.
site_name: CLOTHES AND FOOD BASKET OF LAGRANGE COUNTY
service_description: Provides clothing, perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in LaGrange County -- Limit one (1) every 30 days

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides resources and services that improve the quality of life for seniors.
service_description: Offers activities for older adults, including special interest classes, social activities, travel, and field trips. Transportation may be available within set boundaries.
site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older
Open
Seniors or persons with disabilities and their family, caregivers, and advocates

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12
Living in the Lakeland school district -- Ages 3-22 -- With any form of disability that requires special education services  (determined by assessment)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides reduced-cost dental care to eligible individuals and families.
service_description: Provides low-cost dental care to adults and children in need. Services include extractions, crowns, bridges, partials, and full dentures. Sliding-scale fees are available for youth only. Open service area.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open; adults and children, including restricted service area for youth with Medicaid

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing a birthing center for low-risk obstetrics in LaGrange County. Primarily serves the Amish community, but anyone is welcome.
service_description: Provides baby delivery services for low-risk obstetrics patients. Primarily serves the Amish community, but anyone is welcome.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for LaGrange County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Lagrange County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Lagrange County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves LaGrange County
Age 18 or older

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Lagrange County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Varies; call for details.
site_eligibility: Open
Victims and witnesses of major crimes in Lagrange County

To File for Child Support Assistance -- Living in Lagrange County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides emergency shelter to persons and families who are fleeing domestic violence and in need of immediate crisis intervention.
service_description: Offers a shelter for women, with or without children, involved in domestic violence. Other services for women or men experiencing or who have experienced domestic violence include advocacy, 24-hour crisis line, help obtaining protection orders, court accompaniment, community referrals, and support group meetings on issues of abuse and preventing abuse.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an intake assessment or for information on obtaining services other than shelter.
site_eligibility: Women with or without children having experience with domestic violence -- Not under the influence of drugs or alcohol -- Men who have experienced domestic violence can get services, but not shelter

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF LAGRANGE COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds and renovates affordable housing for qualified individuals and families.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF LAGRANGE COUNTY
service_description: Sells donated building supplies, used appliances, and other home items to the general public at a discount. Donations accepted during store hours or by arrangement. Pickup (within set boundaries) is available for large-item donations.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

Household income between 30%-60% of area median (Call or see website for current amounts.) -- Stable employment or other source of income --  Currently have reasonably good credit -- Satisfactory criminal background check

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides youth services.
service_description: Offers after-school enrichment activities such as arts and crafts and homework help to students in third grade through sixth grade attending school in Lagrange County.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information or to register.
site_eligibility: Attending a Lagrange County school -- Grades 3-6

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Call to request food.
site_eligibility: Only accepting those requesting food on emergency basis

agency_desc: A nonprofit animal shelter that contracts with the county of Lagrange to provide animal control services.
service_description: Enforces animal-related ordinances in Lagrange County, responds to animal-related emergencies, impounds stray domestic animals, and accepts surrendered animals from the public. Provides lost-and-found services, and adoption for homeless dogs and cats.
site_details: To report: Call the shelter during office hours. -- For after-hours emergencies, call County Dispatch. -- To surrender: Call for an appointment. Owners complete paperwork in the office before bringing the animal into the shelter. -- To claim an impounded animal or to adopt an animal: Call to schedule an appointment.

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to leave a message requesting to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in the county.
service_description: Serves as a voter registration site and provides information about voting, candidates, absentee voting, and volunteering to work the polls. Oversees county-level elections, candidate filings, and campaign finance.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.

site_schedule.name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
Child Support Assistance/Enforcement
site_schedule.schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_eligibility: Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election
Varies by service; serves Lagrange County

Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county
Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Lagrange County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Lagrange County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call, visit website, or walk in during business hours for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Lagrange County

agency_desc: Provides electric service to customers in portions of Lagrange County.
service_description: Provides electric service to customers in portions of Lagrange county.
site_details: Call or walk in for assistance; bill can be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is available at this location.
site_eligibility: Addresses within set boundaries in Lagrange County

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Lagrange County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Lagrange County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
site_details: Call for assistance.

site_schedule.name: General Relief Appeals/Complaints
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 8:30am

site_schedule.name: Local Officials Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 8:30am

site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Lagrange County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways. Offers empty sandbags to Lagrange County households during times of flooding.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Lagrange County dispatch. -- For sandbags during times of flooding, be prepared to fill and haul sandbags.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Lagrange County)

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: Our mission is to strengthen our communities and to improve the health and well-being of those we are privileged to serve. We use evidence based practices that treat the whole person. Our team of board-certified psychiatrists and psychologists, highly trained and certified therapists, nurses, and case workers deliver comprehensive care and treatment for mental health conditions.
service_description: Provides assessment and outpatient counseling and treatment for people with substance use issues and their families. Also includes intensive outpatient services and drug screenings.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Northeastern Center helps individuals in northeastern Indiana achieve emotional and mental wholeness through accessible, affordable and quality behavioral health services.
service_description: Provides assessment and outpatient counseling and treatment for people with substance abuse issues and their families. Intensive outpatient services are available.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call the office to schedule an appointment.

agency_name: COMPASSION PREGNANCY CENTERS OF NORTHEAST INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit, pro-life organization that offers maternity outreach, parenting education, and material support to pregnant women and women with young children.
site_name: COMPASSION PREGNANCY CENTERS OF NORTHEAST INDIANA - LAGRANGE
service_description: Provides an incentive program that encourages pregnant women and new mothers and fathers to access parenting education, health care, and related services. Participants earn coupons that can be redeemed for maternity and baby supplies such as diapers, infant and toddler clothing, maternity clothing, and cribs.  Classes are available for pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, parenting, relationship and life skills, and fatherhood.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women, mothers, or fathers with children up to age 3
Pregnant women, Mothers with children up to age 3
